oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Isaac Shelby to John Sevier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Isaac Shelby to John Sevier regarding misrepresentations of the part Colonel William Campbell took in the Battle of King's Mountain, October 7, 1780.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Often called the "Father of Tennessee," John Sevier was born in Virginia but later moved to Washington County, Tennessee (then a part of North Carolina). Sevier became a hero after he, Shelby, and Campbell led armed settlers against the British at the Battle of Kings Mountain (1780). In 1796, Sevier was elected Tennessee's first governor.
